Ashley, Betty, Carlos, Dick, and Elgin went shopping. Each had a whole number of dollars to spend, and together they had $ \$56$. The absolute difference between the amounts Ashley and Betty had to spend was $ \$19$. The absolute difference between the amounts Betty and Carlos had was $ \$7$, between Carlos and Dick was $ \$5$, between Dick and Elgin was $ \$4$, and between Elgin and Ashley was $ \$11$. How much did Elgin have?\\
\\
$ \textbf{(A)}\ \$6\qquad 
\textbf{(B)}\ \$7\qquad 
\textbf{(C)}\ \$8\qquad 
\textbf{(D)}\ \$9\qquad 
\textbf{(E)}\ \$10$
